comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2622) (MYAIR-3444)
# 1. If the user selects a navigation tab that has a badge icon, then Monte Carlo shall execute the push notification associated with the tab badge icon.
# Note: Score tip push notification does no action. Coaching tip or Sleep library push notification updates the appropriate section and auto-navigates user to appropriate media asset.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2623) (MYAIR-3374)
# 1. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a coaching tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 2. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a sleep library push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 3. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the coaching tab and the coaching tab is pressed, then the badge shall be removed
# 4. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a score tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the dashboard tab
# 5. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the dashboard tab and the dashboard tab is pressed or on App launch, then the badge shall be removed
# 6. Given Monte Carlo has tab badge icons when App is closed (user or OS closed), then the previous tab badge icons shall be shown when App is re-launched.
# Note: When Monte Carlo is in foreground and a push notification is received, the push will NOT show up in system tray; it will only result in the push's associated navigation tab being badged.
# Note: For android use this command to get the Token = adb logcat -v time | grep Refreshed
# Note: For android use this command to get the AccountIdentifier = adb logcat -v time | egrep AccountIdentifier
#ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MYAIR-3528) (MCA-2521)
# 1. When App receives a push notification, regardless if App is in foreground or background, then a badge shall be shown on the App launch icon.
# 2. The badge on the App launch icon shall persist as long as there are outstanding push notifications to be actioned by user.

# Note: When App is in the background and a push notification is received the push notification details are displayed in the system tray.  When a user opens the App, regardless if opened by App Icon or system tray push notification, the App Icon badge is removed and all system tray push notifications are cleared (i.e. no longer outstanding)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled
notifications are enabled in System settings
existing badge icon on "Dashboard" tab has been removed
existing badge icon on "Coaching" tab has been removed

elements.name: Verify the badge icon appears over the Coaching tab following a "Sleep library" push notification, and is removed when the Coaching tab is tapped.

steps.name: I open the app on the "Coaching" screen
I wait for coaching sync
a "SleepLibrary" push notification is received
I should see a badge icon on the "Coaching" tab
I tap the "Coaching" tab
I should not see a badge icon on the "Coaching" tab

name: Show badge icon when new data is received from patient portal or from coaching tip push notification

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-801) (MYAIR-1330)
# 1. The user shall be able to check for new coaching content from Patient Portal

# 2. When the user visits coaching and the coaching section has not been updated for more than 1 hour, then the coaching shall be requested from Patient Portal (note: does not include opening from a coaching Push notification)
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-153) (MYAIR-101)
# 1. The user shall be shown the coaching assets that have been generated from Patient Portal since registration
# 2. The coaching shall be shown chronologically from the most recent item to the oldest item
# 3. Selecting a video shall start the video
# NOTE: For iOS we have "More" screen and for android is "Settings" screen

# NOTE: Testing for coaching update by tagging push notifications will be tested in MYAIR-1060 story. These following scenarios do not apply to the case of accessing coaching from push notification item

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account with coaching data
Push notifications are enabled
notifications are enabled in System settings

elements.name: Coaching content has not received updates for an hour, so if the user power cycles the device and relaunches the app, the app should still receive a call from patient portal by automatic page refresh

steps.name: I open the app on the "Coaching Timeline" screen
I wait for coaching sync
I should see the current "Coaching Timeline" content
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
it has been "61" minutes since last coaching sync
Patient Portal responses are delayed by "5" seconds for "1" response
I close the app

comments.value: # Note: for manual testing, power cycle the device after closing the app

steps.name: I open the app on the "Coaching" screen
Coaching Content should be requested
I should see the current "Coaching Timeline" content

name: Coaching History and when to update

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-510) (MYAIR-3128)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall provide a method to contact support
# 2. The user shall be able to select a category, subcategory and question for the help request
# 3. When the user has selected a category, subcategory and question, Monte Carlo shall provide a link to the relevant support section.
# 4. The user shall be able to enter a description for the help request
# 5. The description shall be limited to 400 characters
# 6. When the user has chosen a category, subcategory, question, and written at least one character in the description, they shall be able to submit the help request
# 7. When the user has submitted the help request, Monte Carlo shall send the user's help request, first name, email address and FG serial number to Patient Portal
# Note: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Support+screen+improvement
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1636) (MYAIR-2015)
# 1. If a user selects a clinically related question in the support form, then they will be shown a message to contact their care provider
# note: this behaviour is because the support service can not answer treatment or therapy related queries.
# https://confluence.ec2.local/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=39259556

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Monte Carlo shall provide a method to contact support and have various items to select in Subcategory for Treatment Category

steps.name: I open the app on the "Settings" screen
I tap the "myAir Support" item
I should be on the "myAir Support" screen
I tap the "contact myAir support" item
I should be on the "Contact support" screen
I pick "Treatment" for the "Category" field
there should be the option "Comfort" in the "Subcategory" field
there should be the option "Side effects" in the "Subcategory" field
there should be the option "Additional support" in the "Subcategory" field

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-694) (MCA-2048)
# 1. Each sleep score shall be accompanied with a message according to the following rules:
# | requirement id | Condition                               | Text                                                                      | Notes                                                     |
# | 1a             | Usage is greater than 7 hours           | Excellent results, name! As you start to see the benefits in your life,   | name is replaced with the user's first name               |
# |                |                                         | you’ll never look back.                                                   |                                                           |
# | 1b             | Usage is less than or equal to 7 hours  | That's a great score! You're well on your way to improving your health.   |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 4 hours                |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1c             | Usage is less than or equal to 4 hours  | Good start! Keep going. Like learning anything new, using therapy will    |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 2 hours                | get easier the more you practice.                                         |                                                           |
# | 1d             | Usage is less than or equal to 2 hours  | Keep going name! If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out  | name is replaced with the users first name                |
# |                | and greater than 0 minutes              | support. Try the myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                 |                                                           |
# | 1e             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used last night! Do you need more support? Try the    |                                                           |
# |                | for the latest sleep record             | myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                                  |                                                           |
# | 1f             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used this night.                                      |                                                           |
# |                | not for the latest sleep record         |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1g             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | Last night's data isn't available yet.                                    |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there is data for the       |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | previous sleep record, or this is the   |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | only sleep record available             |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1h             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | myAir hasn't received data from your machine for some time. To ensure     |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there has been no data for  | that your machine can send data, review the tips on the Missing Data page.|                                                           |
# |                | the most recent 2 or more sleep records |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1i             | No data, score is not for the latest    | myAir didn't receive data from your machine for this night.               |                                                           |
# |                | sleep record                            |                                                                           |                                                           |
# Note: Monte Carlo only receives the number of therapy sessions per sleep record and does not know when each therapy session starts and ends.
# Note: Monte Carlo has the timestamps when therapy starts and stops

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when running 2 hours of therapy, applicable message appears

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I should see the value "Keep going Jane!" in the "Score Message" label
I should see the value "If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out support. Try the myAir Library in the Coaching tab, or talk to your clinician." in the "Score Explanation" label

arguments.val: If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out support. Try the myAir Library in the Coaching tab, or talk to your clinician.

# Note: Monte Carlo has the timestamps when therapy starts and stops

I wait for data sync
I should see the value "Keep going Jane!" in the "Score Message" label
I should see the value "If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out support. Try the myAir Library in the Coaching tab, or talk to your clinician." in the "Score Explanation" label

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-792)
# 1. If Monte Carlo receives a result from Patient Portal that the user is not logged in, then the user shall be shown the login screen.
# 2. If the user has been logged out, the login screen shall be pre-filled with the username of the last logged in user
# 3. user can sign out
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-850)
# 1. If Monte Carlo receives a result from Patient Portal that the user is not logged in, then the user shall be shown the login screen.
# 2. If the user has been logged out, the login screen shall be pre-filled with the username of the last logged in user
# Note: To generate the "login session expired" you can login from other device and this will force to expire your session on this device

elements.name: When the the app login session is expired in the "Coaching" screen, login screen should show if patient portal coaching service is triggered

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
the login session expires
I navigate to the "Coaching" screen
I should see the "Session timeout" dialog
I dismiss the "Session timeout" error message
I should be on the "Signin" screen
I should see the "last signed" email address in the "Email" field

elements.name: When the the app login session is expired in the "About me" screen, login screen should show if patient portal profile service is triggered

I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I press "Profile" section
the login session expires
I select "About me" profile item
I should see the "Session timeout" dialog
I dismiss the "Session timeout" error message
I should be on the "Signin" screen
I should see the "last signed" email address in the "Email" field

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRTIERIA: (MCA-2964) (MYAIR-3774)
#  1. The patient shall be able to enable and disable email coaching notifications.
#  2. The patient shall be able to enable and disable SMS coaching notifications.
#  3. The patient shall be able to enable and disable push coaching notifications.
#  4. The patient shall be able to enable and disable email cleaning reminder notifications.
#  5. The patient shall be able to enable and disable SMS cleaning reminder notifications.
#  6. The patient shall be able to enable and disable push cleaning reminder notifications.

#  7. If SMS notifications are turned on and the user does not have a phone number in their profile, the user shall be required to enter a phone number (note: see MYAIR-1287/MCA-701 for phone number confirmation requirements)
# Note 1 :  All test scenarios in this feature file require using Patient Portal server
# Note 2 : "More" screen for iOS is similar to "Settings" screen for android
# Note 3 : "Verify" screen for iOS is similar to "VERIFY" screen for android
# For Cleaning Reminders
# Note 4: The account for this test should have a Phone Number associated with the account
# Note 5: Reference page for Cleaning reminders: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Push%2C+Coaching+Tips+and+Library
# Note 6: Reference page for Cleaning reminders of notification settings: https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/myAir+Notification+Settings
# Note 7: Cleaning Reminders - how to trigger events - https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MYAIR/Cleaning+and+replacement+reminders

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

comments.value: # Note 1: Make sure that SMS notifications have never been enabled for the current installation of the app, and the user has not entered a phone number in his/her profile
# Note 2: Use a valid phone number and confirmation code when testing manually

elements.name: Verify that the user can enable SMS Coaching notifications on "My notifications" screen by providing valid cell phone number.

steps.name: the logged in user does not have a validated phone number for SMS notifications
I open the app on the "My notifications" screen
I wait for network sync
I toggle the "SMS coaching" switch on
I should be on the "Register cell phone" screen
I enter "1234567890" into the "Enter cell phone" field
I press "Next"
I should be on the "Confirm cell phone" screen
I enter "CONFIRM" into the "Confirm cell phone" field
I press "Verify"
I wait for network sync
I should be on the "My notifications" screen
I see the "SMS coaching" switch is turned on

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-4632) (MYAIR-5094)

# 1. Given sleep data has not been requested from Patient Portal for at least 5 minutes, when the user navigates to Dashboard, Monte Carlo shall request the last 30 days of sleep data from patient portal.

# 2. Given sleep data has not been requested from Patient Portal for at least 5 minutes, when the user navigates to the current month History screen, Monte Carlo shall request the last 30 days of sleep data from patient portal.
# 3. When the user navigates to a previous month History screen, Monte Carlo shall request the sleep data for that given month from patient portal, provided it has not already been requested.
# Note 1: The date from which sleep data is requested is the most recent of:
# (a) 12 months before the current date
# (b) the date from which sleep data was last successfully received
# Note 2: Monte Carlo will request up to last 12 months of sleep data regardless of when user account was created/activated
# Note 3: Patient Portal will only send sleep data from date account is activated and onward

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled

elements.name: Verify when sleep data has been requested from Patient Portal 4 minutes ago, when user navigates to a screen that displays Sleep Data, app does not fetch machine data at all

steps.name: I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I see these scores
I navigate to the "Profile" screen
it has been "240" seconds since data sync
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
data should have been synced "1" time

# Note 3: Patient Portal will only send sleep data from date account is activated and onward

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-4632) (MYAIR-5094)

# 1. Given sleep data has not been requested from Patient Portal for at least 5 minutes, when the user navigates to Dashboard, Monte Carlo shall request the last 30 days of sleep data from patient portal.

# 2. Given sleep data has not been requested from Patient Portal for at least 5 minutes, when the user navigates to the current month History screen, Monte Carlo shall request the last 30 days of sleep data from patient portal.
# 3. When the user navigates to a previous month History screen, Monte Carlo shall request the sleep data for that given month from patient portal, provided it has not already been requested.
# Note 1: The date from which sleep data is requested is the most recent of:
# (a) 12 months before the current date
# (b) the date from which sleep data was last successfully received
# Note 2: Monte Carlo will request up to last 12 months of sleep data regardless of when user account was created/activated
# Note 3: Patient Portal will only send sleep data from date account is activated and onward

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled

elements.name: Verify when sleep data has been requested from Patient Portal 4 minutes ago, when user navigates to a screen that displays Sleep Data, app does not fetch machine data at all

steps.name: I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I see these scores
I navigate to the "Usage Hours History" screen
it has been "240" seconds since data sync
I navigate to the "Event History" screen
I wait for data sync
data should have been synced "1" time

name: View and update personal details in profile
description:
(MCA-164)
(MYAIR-2958)
As a patient
I want to update my profile
so that my Monte Carlo experience is personalised.

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3845) (MCA-3433)
# 1. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to view the phone number in their profile
# 2. If the server indicates the user does not have a validated phone number, the phone number field in the profile shall be hidden
# 3. Given the user has a validated phone number in their profile, the user shall be able to change the phone number
# 4. Given the user has entered an invalid phone number length, the user shall be notified the phone number is invalid
# Note 1: The user must enter a phone number between 1 and 12 digits in length.  The server validates if the phone number is valid or invalid.
# Note: 2: The list of available countries supported is determined by server, see MYAIR-3885 for full list of countries supported by App; server may or may not support SMS for a given country.
# 5. Given the user has entered a valid phone number, they shall be asked to enter a confirmation code
# 6. Given the user has entered a confirmation code, the App shall send the confirmation code to server
# 7. If the server indicates that the confirmation is invalid, the App shall inform the user the confirmation code is invalid
# 8. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to delete the phone number in their profile
# Note 3: A validated phone number is one which has been matched with a confirmation code.
# Note: Default phone number for the server mock is 5555555555 (For Automation Purposes only)
# Note: "Change cell phone" screen is same as "Register cell phone" screen (For Automation Purposes only)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when the user goes back from authorization code update, they will be redirected to Change cell phone screen

steps.name: the logged in user has a validated phone number for SMS notifications
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I tap the "Edit" button
I tap the "Cell phone" field
I should be on the "Register cell phone" screen
I enter "1234567890" into the "Enter cell phone" field
I press "Next"
I should be on the "Confirm cell phone" screen
I tap the "Back" button
I should be on the "Register cell phone" screen
I should see the value "1234567890" in the "Enter cell phone" field

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-187)
# Note 1: This card deals with the general use case scenario. Activation errors and retries will be handled in another card.
# Note 2: This includes getting an authentication token from patient portal
# Note 3: This card requires that an api call is made to login service
# 1. If the login username and password submitted by the patient are authenticated, the patient shall be shown the Dashboard
# 2. If the user entered an email that does not exist in the system, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 3. If the user entered a password that does not match the one associated with the email entered, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 4. If Monte Carlo cannot establish communications with the authentication server, the user shall be notified of the error
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2309) (MYAIR-3226)
# 1. After the first successful login of a user, Monte Carlo shall post the following to Patient Portal:
# 1a. date and time that the app was first used
# 1b. account identifier
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-131)
# 1. When the user selects the forgot password option, Monte Carlo shall launch the myAir forgot password page.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-347)
# 1. When the user selects the forgot password option, Monte Carlo shall launch the myAir forgot password page.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-219)
# Note 1: This includes getting an authentication token from patient portal
# 1. If the login username and password submitted by the patient are authenticated and the account is active, the patient shall be shown the Dashboard
# 2. If the user entered an email that does not exist in the system, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 3. If the user entered a password that does not match the one associated with the email entered, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 4. If Monte Carlo cannot establish communications with the authentication server, the user shall be notified of the error
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-747)
# 1. On every login, Monte Carlo shall post the following to Patient Portal:
# 1a. push token (if user is logged in and push is enabled)
# 1b. platform (i.e. iOS)
# 1c. date and time that the app was first used
# 1d. account identifier
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-147) (MYAIR-355)
# Note 1: This card deals with the scenario when the user has entered incorrect login details multiple times.
# 1. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be told to wait and try again
# 2. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be able to enter log in credentials
# 3. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be able to start the reset password workflow
# Note: Have to perform manual testing with Patient Portal server for this test scenario because local Patient Portal server accepts all username and password input.

steps.name: I install the app for the first time
I open the app on the "Signin" screen

comments.value: # Note:  Have to perform manual testing with Patient Portal server for this test scenario so data are posted to Patient Portal
# Note:  Remove comment to test for push token when @MYAIR-1060 is implemented

elements.name: When the user logs in with valid email address and password, date and time app was first used, and account identifier to Patient Portal

steps.name: I enter "test.user1640@gmail.com" into the "Email" field
I enter "Password1" into the "Password" field
I press the "Sign In" button
date and time that the app was first used are sent to Patient Portal
account identifier is sent to Patient Portal

elements.name: The user tries to sign in with the same account with invalid credentials too many times and shall be told to wait and try again. The user
elements.description: can still enter an email/password, but cannot login with correct credentials for the frozen account.

steps.name: Patient Portal will send an invalid password response

Patient Portal will send an account frozen response

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2391) (MYAIR-3111)
# 1.The patient shall be able to view their sleep score and score breakdown for the most recent 30 nights, up to and including the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "Last night".
# 2. The data available to the user shall be displayed in reverse chronological order.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.
# Note 3: "previous nights" includes sleep records with no data or zero usage
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2442) (MYAIR-453)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2443) (MYAIR-697)
# 1. When the user navigates to the Dashboard, on launch and by selecting the Dashboard menu item, the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night" shall be displayed by Monte Carlo.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify sleep records available to the user shall be displayed in reverse chronological order.

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I see the score for most recent sleep record
I tap the "Sleep Day" field
I should be on the "Date Navigator" screen
there are 5 dates in sleep day list
the sleep day list are in reverse chronological order

name: Sleep Record Navigation and display default sleep record
